title: CSS
desc: Cascading Style Sheets is a stylesheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML.

title: HTML
desc: Hypertext Markup Language is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

title: JavaScript
desc: JavaScript is a programming language that is commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.

title: TypeScript
desc: TypeScript is a programming language that is a super set of JavaScript, offering static typing and other features.
whyILike: Forces you to code clean (well, cleaner), and helps you avoid problems later on.

title: Nuxt.js
desc: Nuxt.js is a framework for creating server-rendered Vue.js applications.

title: Svelte.js
desc: Svelte.js is a framework for building web applications with a reactive architecture.

title: Tailwind CSS
desc: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs.

title: Vue.js
desc: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.

title: Nuxt UI

title: Vuetify
desc: Vuetify is a Vue UI framework that implements Material Design components, helping teams build consistent and responsive application interfaces quickly.

title: Go Fiber
desc: Fiber is an Express-inspired web framework for Go focused on high performance, low memory usage, and developer-friendly APIs.

title: ElysiaJS
desc: ElysiaJS is a modern web framework built for Bun that emphasizes end-to-end type safety, speed, and an ergonomic developer experience.

title: Django
desc: Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

title: Node.js
desc: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine for building scalable network applications.

title: Python
desc: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language with a strong emphasis on readability and simplicity.

title: Golang
desc: Golang (Go) is a statically typed, compiled language designed for simplicity, performance, and reliable concurrent programming.

title: Arch Linux
desc: Arch Linux is a lightweight, rolling-release distribution designed for experienced users and developers.

title: Docker
desc: Docker is a tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers.

title: Git
desc: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files and coordinating work on those files among multiple people.

title: Nginx
desc: Nginx is a web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, and HTTP cache.
whyILike: Lightweight way to serve web apps, and as a reverse proxy. I use it to run many services out of a single, light VM.

title: Ubuntu Linux
desc: Ubuntu is a free, open-source operating system based on the Linux kernel.

title: Keycloak
desc: Keycloak is an open-source identity and access management solution that provides single sign-on, user federation, and role-based access control for applications and services.
whyILike: Simple out of the box, powerful when configured, and open source

title: MinIO
desc: MinIO is a high-performance, S3-compatible object storage server often used for private cloud storage, backups, and data-intensive workloads.
whyILike: Simple, AWS S3-like, (used to be) free and open source, and super easy to deploy, both for dev purposes and for production

title: Docker Compose
desc: Docker Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container applications using a single declarative YAML configuration file.
